quest.name: Zero Tolerance Teahouse
journal: A teahouse serving girl of Kugane is at her wit's end due to the incessant repetitions of an ebrious citizen.
objectives: Dump the pail of cold well water on the fabulously foxed fellow.
Speak with the teahouse serving girl.

dialogue.name: TEAHOUSE02669
dialogue.text: Enough! I can't stand it anymore. How many times are you going to recant the same old tired tale!?

dialogue.name: DRANKER02669
dialogue.text: Shut your mouth and open your earsh, you little bint! Thish shtatue is Zuiko of Clan Buhenâ”€the greatesht warlord Hingashi has ever sheen! The founder of Suenokuni!

dialogue.name: DRANKER02669
dialogue.text: Let's shee... How many yearsh ago were it that he...<burp>...were Lord of Suenokuni...

dialogue.name: TEAHOUSE02669
dialogue.text: Excuse me there, miladymilord. Would you please do something to cool off this hot-headed drunkard?

dialogue.name: TEAHOUSE02669
dialogue.text: I've just now sent a teahouse hireling to fetch some water from the well. If you are able to find her, ask her for a pail of cold well water. I'll do what I can to keep this ale-soaked sod from bothering the other patrons until you return.

dialogue.name: TEAHOUSE02669
dialogue.text: I've just now sent a teahouse hireling to fetch some water from the well. If you are able to find her, ask her for a pail of cold well water. I'll do what I can to keep this ale-soaked sod from bothering the other patrons until you return.

dialogue.name: DRANKER02669
dialogue.text: And thish here'sh the besht part of all. There were... There were... Damn it all. What were I jusht about to shay?

dialogue.name: APPRENTICE02669
dialogue.text: That drunkard is at it again, is he? Well, I've got just the thing for him. Here, take this pail of cold well water and give his head a good dousing. That always seems to do the trick.

dialogue.name: APPRENTICE02669
dialogue.text: Take that pail of cold well water and give that drunkard's head a good dousing. That always seems to do the trick.

dialogue.name: DRANKER02669
dialogue.text: Oh no, I've gone and got good and drunk again, aren't I? I'm sho shorry. It'sh jusht, I were a graveguard for the branch family of a branch family of a branch family of Clan Buhen, I were.

dialogue.name: DRANKER02669
dialogue.text: My love of the drink got me to where you shee me now. I didn't never mean to bother nobody. I'm shorry. Sho very, very shorry.

dialogue.name: TEAHOUSE02669
dialogue.text: Go ahead and dump that pail of cold well water square on that drunken mummer's head!

dialogue.name: TEAHOUSE02669
dialogue.text: Thank you for your trouble, stranger. I hate to admit it, but as prominent and well-to-do an establishment as our Umineko Teahouse is, we do find ourselves a close neighbor to the Hostelry. Drunkards are not as few and far between as we would like.

dialogue.name: TEAHOUSE02669
dialogue.text: But that's not to say their lot is all bad. There are many whom the drink drives to be quite generous. Those souls are always willing to part with a pretty gil to buy whatever tea and sweets we recommend.

dialogue.name: TEAHOUSE02669
dialogue.text: That is just one of the many reasons why I have come to love this city. I hope you come to grow as fond of it as I have. Good day to you, then!

obj.n: By the Grace of Lord Lolorito
